personal.name: Kishan Rajdev
personal.title: Researcher | Full-Stack Engineer
personal.bio: I am a master’s student in Computer Science (thesis) at Troy University with a strong focus on research. During my graduate studies, I have worked on multiple research projects spanning machine learning, computer vision, uncertainty estimation, trustworthy AI, and interdisciplinary data analysis research in American football. I have a solid foundation in computer science fundamentals and currently maintaining a 4.0 GPA in my graduate studies. I also have prior industry experience as a full-stack engineer in startups and product-based companies, where I contributed to the development of scalable real-world systems. I am interested in pursuing a research-oriented career in academia or industry.

areas.title: A Comparative Study of Non-Bayesian Ensemble Methods for Uncertainty Quantification in Image Classification
areas.description: I conducted a comprehensive evaluation of Deep Ensembles, Snapshot Ensembles, Batch Ensembles, and Hyper-Deep Ensembles for uncertainty quantification in image classification. The study involved assessing in-distribution accuracy and calibration on CIFAR-10, robustness under distribution shift (CIFAR-10-C), and out-of-distribution detection using SVHN. This work is also submitted to CVPR 2026 and is under review.

areas.title: Diversity-Enhanced Snapshot Ensembles (DESE)
areas.description: Proposed a lightweight extension of Snapshot Ensembles that enhances robustness by selecting only snapshots that are meaningfully diverse in parameter space using cosine similarity and in prediction space using prediction disagreement on a validation set. This research has been submitted to ACMSE 2026 and is under review.

areas.title: Uncertainty-Aware Skin Cancer Classification with Deep Ensembles
areas.description: Evaluated deep ensembles for seven-class skin lesion classification using the ISIC dataset, demonstrating improved diagnostic accuracy and well-calibrated uncertainty estimates for risk-sensitive medical applications. This work has been submitted as a poster paper to ACMSE 2026.

areas.title: Adaptive Coverage Planning Under Uncertainty in Autonomous Cleaning Robots
areas.description: I built a POMDP-based planning framework for a robot operating in a grid-based environment under partial observability, where the robot maintains a dirt-belief for each tile to make cleaning decisions under uncertainty. This research has been submitted to CVPR 2026 and is under review.

areas.title: Show Me the Money: Factors Contributing to Collegiate Football NIL Valuations
areas.description: co-authored this interdisciplinary project with Troy University’s Sports Management faculty, where I performed data preprocessing and ANCOVA to analyze multi-factor influences on NIL values. This research has been submitted to the Journal of Sports Economics and is under review.

areas.title: Secure Standard-Based Approach to Cloud Interoperability in E-Government
areas.description: co-authored this research, which aimed to strengthen cloud interoperability for e-government systems by adopting a multi-cloud architecture to avoid vendor lock-in. I contributed to conducting interoperability experiments across Azure and AWS. This work has been accepted at CloudTech'25.
